result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess alcohol, with random testing
.

PO is to do a COMPAS report with the def

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Cash bond on file is applied to Court financial obligations owed - PAID IN FULL - DOC DOES NOT COLLECT

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 31 days if probation is ever revoked

The Court may grant an early discharge following the successful completion of the conditions of this Court Order, adherence to the rules of supervision, and upon the recommendation of the PO

If probation is revoke or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination filed
For Probation Violation

State by Skemp /  Def w/ Atty Sean O'neill
Stmt of Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
Ct 1 - Fel BJ - Def pleads GUILTY
Crt finds plea is FVI made - sufficient factual basis exists - findsd ef guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 18 mos w/ conditions:  PO to do COMPAS evaluation w/ def;  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  No alcohol w/ random testing;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Credit for 31 days if probation is ever revoked;  Def can ask for early discharge if approp.

From: Atty O'Neill Re: req set for trial after 14CF133 is concluded.
TWB; quash warrant

Def w/Atty O'neill
O'Neill: other case is set w/EML in June & that's why we haven't settled this - req to get another date after 6/24
CRT: Well you were supposed to show up here yesterday & you didn't & that is why I issued warrant
CRT: Warrant quashed
CC: 7/8 @ 10:45 (TWB)
Def NA - CRT issues Warrant for $1000 cash

State by Keller / Def in person w/ Atty Sean O'Neill
O'Neill:  as of 3-3-15 bond is set at $5k - applies to both 14CF133 & 15CF144.  Def has been in custody 29 days.  Outlines prev. bond history - COMPAS showed def as low risk at that time.  Violations outlined.  Last OWI offense was in 2003...for 9 yrs was sober & compliant w/ trmt. Def has job, does not have a lot of $, but could come up w/ $500 cash...
Keller leaves to CRT
CRT:  reduce bond to $1000 for both cases
PTC DA is set for 4-17-15 - set this for sometime around there...(STC: 5-21-15 @ 10am)

11:04 am  Def in court w/ Atty Sean William O'Neill.  Def in custody.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No preliminary discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds he F, V & I waives his right to a PH and accepted.  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:  4/17 at 2:30 pm     STC:  5/21 at 10 am   TWB
O'Neill:  The compass shows low pretrial risk.  Eight months of JSS compliance.  Asks for lower cash bond around $500.  I'll have to go before Judge Levine to get that bond lowered also.  Kellis:  It appears that there's one $5,000 cash bond covering all files.  I think the high cash is appropriate here...  O'Neill responds.
COURT comments.  I won't set a separate bond on this case.  Go back before Judge Levine to address bond since his case is more serious.   Bond to remain.

Def in custody w/Atty Wright for O'Neill
Cash bond to remain
PH: 3/17 @ 11 (TWB)
